newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai interbank rate eases, baht firms near close.
newsitem.headline: Thai interbank rate eases, baht firms near close.

text.p: Surplus bank funds helped ease interbank rates on Monday afternoon after dealers found they carried more money than clients needed for festive spending, bank officials said.
"Most banks kept more money than necessary to meet withdrawal demand and they needed to unload some by offering lower rates than in the morning," a dealer said
Dealers said the overnight interbank rate eased to a 14.00-14.50 percent range shortly before closing from 14.50-14.75 in the morning.
The baht firmed to 25.630-25.640 to the dollar in late trading activities from 25.640-25.643 in the morning but against 25.625-26.630 late on Friday.
"It was very quiet today and most people just squared positions rather than hanging on to their dollars," a dealer at a foreign bank said.
The bid/offer range of the one-month dollar/baht swap premium eased to 9.00/10.00 satangs per dollar near the close from 9.50/10.00 in the morning and 9.70/10.20 late on Friday.
The central bank fixed the dollar/baht mid-rate at 25.61 against 25.59 on Friday.
